newsArray.title: India Vs South Africa T20 World Cup 2024 Final Potential Playing XI: Mohammad Siraj IN For Shivam Dube?
creator: ABP News Bureau
newsArray.description: India Vs South Africa T20 World Cup 2024 Final Potential Playing XI: India stand one step away from their destiny, as Rohit Sharma's men are playing yet another final of an ICC event. In the past 3 ICC events, India is the only side to have featured in the final of each tournament, and now have, potentially, their best shot at silverware in recent times.India will be facing South Africa in the T20 World Cup 2024 final, and the 'Men in Blue' might hold a psychological advantage over their opponents, as this event marks as the first-ever final appearance of South Africa's men at an ICC World Cup event in senior category. In their past 7 attmepts in the semi-finals, the Proteas have failed to get through the stage but managed to do so successfully this time around. ALSO READ тАФ India Vs South Africa T20 World Cup 2024 Final: Key Player Battles To Watch Out For#Final Loading тЧ╝я╕ПтЧ╝я╕ПтЦля╕ПтЦля╕ПтЦля╕П#TeamIndia are all set to take on South Africa today in Barbados ЁЯПЭя╕ПDrop in your best wishes for Team India ЁЯЗоЁЯЗ│ in the comments below ЁЯФ╜#T20WorldCup | #SAvIND pic.twitter.com/wSy9UTnwPGтАФ BCCI (@BCCI) June 29, 2024India's journey to the final has remained near perfect, as almost every player stepped up during the tough situations, especially bowlers, as the 'unbeaten' India has so far recorded more than 5 wicket-takers at T20 World Cup 2024.However, the worrying sign for Rohit Sharma's men is the poor form of Virat Kohli and Shivam Dube, as their underwhelming performances have troubled the side at certain stages. With them underperforming, others have have felt the extra burden of stepping up and doing the extra work. ALSO READ тАФ IND vs SA T20 WC 2024 Final Predicted Playing 11: Will Virat Kohli Move Back To Number Three? Mohammad Siraj: The Man For Big OccasionWhile Virat Kohli is a proven commodity and a legend of the game, and it only takes one good day for him to turn up and change the course of the match in India's favour, the same cannot be said for Shivam Dube, as he is in the earlier stages of his career. Shivam Dube has looked extremely clumsy while batting, as technical flaws were clearly visible in his stance, ball-hitting ability, and while judging the pace and bounce off the pitch.With the all-round trio of Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel, and Ravindra Jadeja chipping in with both bat and ball, and fielding as well, there seems to be no clarity or justification on Shivam Dube's presence in the side. The CSK all-rounder dropped a sitter during India Vs Pakistan match, and failed to deliver with the ball during the group stages.Given India's immense depth in batting and an in-form top and middle order (except Virat Kohli), the ICT can potentially replace the all-rounder with Mohammad Siraj for the final, as big players are meant to play at the big stage, on the grand occasion. Mohammad Siraj has been India's best bowler across all the formats in the absence of Jasprit Bumrah and seeing South Africa's woes against pace bowling throughout the tournament, this can very well be the big change in the upcoming final.

newsArray.title: India Vs South Africa T20 World Cup 2024 Final Potential Playing XI: Mohammad Siraj IN For Shivam Dube?
creator: ABP News Bureau
newsArray.description: India Vs South Africa T20 World Cup 2024 Final Potential Playing XI: India stand one step away from their destiny, as Rohit Sharma's men are playing yet another final of an ICC event. In the past 3 ICC events, India is the only side to have featured in the final of each tournament, and now have, potentially, their best shot at silverware in recent times.India will be facing South Africa in the T20 World Cup 2024 final, and the 'Men in Blue' might hold a psychological advantage over their opponents, as this event marks as the first-ever final appearance of South Africa's men at an ICC World Cup event in senior category. In their past 7 attmepts in the semi-finals, the Proteas have failed to get through the stage but managed to do so successfully this time around. ALSO READ тАФ India Vs South Africa T20 World Cup 2024 Final: Key Player Battles To Watch Out For#Final Loading тЧ╝я╕ПтЧ╝я╕ПтЦля╕ПтЦля╕ПтЦля╕П#TeamIndia are all set to take on South Africa today in Barbados ЁЯПЭя╕ПDrop in your best wishes for Team India ЁЯЗоЁЯЗ│ in the comments below ЁЯФ╜#T20WorldCup | #SAvIND pic.twitter.com/wSy9UTnwPGтАФ BCCI (@BCCI) June 29, 2024India's journey to the final has remained near perfect, as almost every player stepped up during the tough situations, especially bowlers, as the 'unbeaten' India has so far recorded more than 5 wicket-takers at T20 World Cup 2024.However, the worrying sign for Rohit Sharma's men is the poor form of Virat Kohli and Shivam Dube, as their underwhelming performances have troubled the side at certain stages. With them underperforming, others have have felt the extra burden of stepping up and doing the extra work. ALSO READ тАФ IND vs SA T20 WC 2024 Final Predicted Playing 11: Will Virat Kohli Move Back To Number Three? Mohammad Siraj: The Man For Big OccasionWhile Virat Kohli is a proven commodity and a legend of the game, and it only takes one good day for him to turn up and change the course of the match in India's favour, the same cannot be said for Shivam Dube, as he is in the earlier stages of his career. Shivam Dube has looked extremely clumsy while batting, as technical flaws were clearly visible in his stance, ball-hitting ability, and while judging the pace and bounce off the pitch.With the all-round trio of Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel, and Ravindra Jadeja chipping in with both bat and ball, and fielding as well, there seems to be no clarity or justification on Shivam Dube's presence in the side. The CSK all-rounder dropped a sitter during India Vs Pakistan match, and failed to deliver with the ball during the group stages.Given India's immense depth in batting and an in-form top and middle order (except Virat Kohli), the ICT can potentially replace the all-rounder with Mohammad Siraj for the final, as big players are meant to play at the big stage, on the grand occasion. Mohammad Siraj has been India's best bowler across all the formats in the absence of Jasprit Bumrah and seeing South Africa's woes against pace bowling throughout the tournament, this can very well be the big change in the upcoming final.

newsArray.description: Rohit Sharma Captaincy Record: T20 World Cup Captaincy Record: Rohit Sharma has led India in their third consecutive ICC championship title within 12 months as India will lock horns with South Africa in the T20 World Cup 2024 final at the Kensington Oval in Bridgetown, Barbados on June 29 (Saturday). After defeating England in the semifinal, Rohit Sharma propelled himself to become the most successful T20I captain with 49 wins, surpassing Pakistan's Babar Azam, who had 48 wins as T20I skipper.Ahead of the IND vs SA T20 World Cup 2024 final, letтАЩs have a look at Rohit SharmaтАЩs captaincy record in the ICC events and across formats as well.ALSO ON ABP Live | From Rohit Sharma's Hometown To Kuldeep Yadav's, Temples Echo With Fans' Prayers For India's Win In IND vs SA Final- WATCHRohit Sharma T20 World Cup Captaincy Record:In T20 World Cups, Rohit has led in 13 matches, winning 11 and losing 2, with a win percentage of 83.33%. Both the losses came in the T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia.Matches: 13Won: 11Lost: 2Tied: 0NR: 1Win%: 83.33%Rohit Sharma ODI World Cup Captaincy Record:Rohit has led India in 11 ODI World Cup matches, all in the ODI World Cup 2023 edition. India won 10 consecutive matches but lost to Australia in the final.Matches: 11Won: 10Lost: 1Tied: 0Win%: 90.90%Rohit Sharma World Test Championship (WTC) Captaincy RecordMatches: 18Won: 12Lost: 4Draw: 2Win%: 66.66%Rohit Sharma T20I Captaincy Record:Rohit Sharma has captained India in 61 T20Is, winning 48 matches and losing 12, achieving a win percentage of 78.33%.Matches: 61Won: 48Lost: 12Tied: 1NR: 1Win%: 78.33%ALSO READ | India Vs South Africa T20 World Cup 2024 Final: Key Player Battles To Watch Out ForRohit Sharma Test Captaincy Record:As Test captain, Rohit Sharma has led in 16 matches, winning 10 and losing 4, with a win percentage of 62.50%.Matches: 16Won: 10Lost: 4Tied: 0Draw: 2Win%: 62.50%Rohit Sharma ODI Captaincy Record:In ODIs, Rohit Sharma has captained in 45 matches, winning 34 and losing 10, with one no-result, resulting in a win percentage of 75.55%.Matches: 45Won: 34Lost: 10Tied: 0Draw: 0NR: 1Win%: 75.55%Rohit Sharma Overall Captaincy Record:Across all three formats, Rohit Sharma has captained in 122 matches, winning 92 and losing 26, with two draws and two no-results, resulting in a win percentage of 75.20%.Matches: 122Won: 92Lost: 26Win%: 75.20%Rohit Sharma IPL Captaincy Record:Rohit Sharma is the most successful IPL captain, leading in 158 matches, winning 87 and losing 67, with four ties, achieving a win percentage of 55.06%.Matches: 158Won: 87Lost: 67Tied: 4Draw: 0NR: 0Win%: 55.06%

newsArray.title: India Vs South Africa T20 World Cup 2024 Final Potential Playing XI: Mohammad Siraj IN For Shivam Dube?
creator: ABP News Bureau
newsArray.description: India Vs South Africa T20 World Cup 2024 Final Potential Playing XI: India stand one step away from their destiny, as Rohit Sharma's men are playing yet another final of an ICC event. In the past 3 ICC events, India is the only side to have featured in the final of each tournament, and now have, potentially, their best shot at silverware in recent times.India will be facing South Africa in the T20 World Cup 2024 final, and the 'Men in Blue' might hold a psychological advantage over their opponents, as this event marks as the first-ever final appearance of South Africa's men at an ICC World Cup event in senior category. In their past 7 attmepts in the semi-finals, the Proteas have failed to get through the stage but managed to do so successfully this time around. ALSO READ тАФ India Vs South Africa T20 World Cup 2024 Final: Key Player Battles To Watch Out For#Final Loading тЧ╝я╕ПтЧ╝я╕ПтЦля╕ПтЦля╕ПтЦля╕П#TeamIndia are all set to take on South Africa today in Barbados ЁЯПЭя╕ПDrop in your best wishes for Team India ЁЯЗоЁЯЗ│ in the comments below ЁЯФ╜#T20WorldCup | #SAvIND pic.twitter.com/wSy9UTnwPGтАФ BCCI (@BCCI) June 29, 2024India's journey to the final has remained near perfect, as almost every player stepped up during the tough situations, especially bowlers, as the 'unbeaten' India has so far recorded more than 5 wicket-takers at T20 World Cup 2024.However, the worrying sign for Rohit Sharma's men is the poor form of Virat Kohli and Shivam Dube, as their underwhelming performances have troubled the side at certain stages. With them underperforming, others have have felt the extra burden of stepping up and doing the extra work. ALSO READ тАФ IND vs SA T20 WC 2024 Final Predicted Playing 11: Will Virat Kohli Move Back To Number Three? Mohammad Siraj: The Man For Big OccasionWhile Virat Kohli is a proven commodity and a legend of the game, and it only takes one good day for him to turn up and change the course of the match in India's favour, the same cannot be said for Shivam Dube, as he is in the earlier stages of his career. Shivam Dube has looked extremely clumsy while batting, as technical flaws were clearly visible in his stance, ball-hitting ability, and while judging the pace and bounce off the pitch.With the all-round trio of Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel, and Ravindra Jadeja chipping in with both bat and ball, and fielding as well, there seems to be no clarity or justification on Shivam Dube's presence in the side. The CSK all-rounder dropped a sitter during India Vs Pakistan match, and failed to deliver with the ball during the group stages.Given India's immense depth in batting and an in-form top and middle order (except Virat Kohli), the ICT can potentially replace the all-rounder with Mohammad Siraj for the final, as big players are meant to play at the big stage, on the grand occasion. Mohammad Siraj has been India's best bowler across all the formats in the absence of Jasprit Bumrah and seeing South Africa's woes against pace bowling throughout the tournament, this can very well be the big change in the upcoming final.

newsArray.title: Rohit Sharma Captaincy Record In ICC Titles Ahead Of IND vs SA T20 World Cup 2024 Final
creator: ABP News Bureau
newsArray.description: Rohit Sharma Captaincy Record: T20 World Cup Captaincy Record: Rohit Sharma has led India in their third consecutive ICC championship title within 12 months as India will lock horns with South Africa in the T20 World Cup 2024 final at the Kensington Oval in Bridgetown, Barbados on June 29 (Saturday). After defeating England in the semifinal, Rohit Sharma propelled himself to become the most successful T20I captain with 49 wins, surpassing Pakistan's Babar Azam, who had 48 wins as T20I skipper.Ahead of the IND vs SA T20 World Cup 2024 final, letтАЩs have a look at Rohit SharmaтАЩs captaincy record in the ICC events and across formats as well.ALSO ON ABP Live | From Rohit Sharma's Hometown To Kuldeep Yadav's, Temples Echo With Fans' Prayers For India's Win In IND vs SA Final- WATCHRohit Sharma T20 World Cup Captaincy Record:In T20 World Cups, Rohit has led in 13 matches, winning 11 and losing 2, with a win percentage of 83.33%. Both the losses came in the T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia.Matches: 13Won: 11Lost: 2Tied: 0NR: 1Win%: 83.33%Rohit Sharma ODI World Cup Captaincy Record:Rohit has led India in 11 ODI World Cup matches, all in the ODI World Cup 2023 edition. India won 10 consecutive matches but lost to Australia in the final.Matches: 11Won: 10Lost: 1Tied: 0Win%: 90.90%Rohit Sharma World Test Championship (WTC) Captaincy RecordMatches: 18Won: 12Lost: 4Draw: 2Win%: 66.66%Rohit Sharma T20I Captaincy Record:Rohit Sharma has captained India in 61 T20Is, winning 48 matches and losing 12, achieving a win percentage of 78.33%.Matches: 61Won: 48Lost: 12Tied: 1NR: 1Win%: 78.33%ALSO READ | India Vs South Africa T20 World Cup 2024 Final: Key Player Battles To Watch Out ForRohit Sharma Test Captaincy Record:As Test captain, Rohit Sharma has led in 16 matches, winning 10 and losing 4, with a win percentage of 62.50%.Matches: 16Won: 10Lost: 4Tied: 0Draw: 2Win%: 62.50%Rohit Sharma ODI Captaincy Record:In ODIs, Rohit Sharma has captained in 45 matches, winning 34 and losing 10, with one no-result, resulting in a win percentage of 75.55%.Matches: 45Won: 34Lost: 10Tied: 0Draw: 0NR: 1Win%: 75.55%Rohit Sharma Overall Captaincy Record:Across all three formats, Rohit Sharma has captained in 122 matches, winning 92 and losing 26, with two draws and two no-results, resulting in a win percentage of 75.20%.Matches: 122Won: 92Lost: 26Win%: 75.20%Rohit Sharma IPL Captaincy Record:Rohit Sharma is the most successful IPL captain, leading in 158 matches, winning 87 and losing 67, with four ties, achieving a win percentage of 55.06%.Matches: 158Won: 87Lost: 67Tied: 4Draw: 0NR: 0Win%: 55.06%
